channel.title: Where do you sell
channel.description: Where do you sell let's say a new concept for Jeep or Audi[s]o[/s].

item.title: Where do you sell
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:13, topic:409171”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=510453.msg3705579#msg3705579 date=1313012584]
Where do you think I could sell a tank design, my father has been teaching my engineering and how engines work since I was a little boy and over the years I made blue prints for a light weight combination of an ATV and a Battle tank that is twice as strong as the military currently uses in the USA and would be 5 times as light weight. Also I cut down the costs dramatically for the shell casing on its bullets. Kinda scared to just go to the government or a military base cause I don’t really trust my country to not steal it and kill me to cover up the theft.
[/quote]There’s this show on Discovery Channel, a small company builds innovative vechicles for the military and they demonstrate it, and if the army likes it, they buy it.

So before you could ever get anywhere with your tank design, you should make a prototype first for demoing, maybe tape it and send it to the military. I don’t think that design only is going to get you anywhere. You should watch the show.[/quote]
Oh… damn, I don’t think I could afford the 500k-600k USD for a prototype, maybe later on in life haha, but I do have extreamly detailed blue prints and I built 1/12 of the smaller engines for the traction wheels.

Read full topic

item.title: Where do you sell
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:12, topic:409171”]Where do you think I could sell a tank design, my father has been teaching my engineering and how engines work since I was a little boy and over the years I made blue prints for a light weight combination of an ATV and a Battle tank that is twice as strong as the military currently uses in the USA and would be 5 times as light weight. Also I cut down the costs dramatically for the shell casing on its bullets. Kinda scared to just go to the government or a military base cause I don’t really trust my country to not steal it and kill me to cover up the theft.[/quote]There’s this show on Discovery Channel, a small company builds innovative vechicles for the military and they demonstrate it, and if the army likes it, they buy it.

So before you could ever get anywhere with your tank design, you should make a prototype first for demoing, maybe tape it and send it to the military. I don’t think that design only is going to get you anywhere. You should watch the show.

Read full topic

item.title: Where do you sell
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Where do you think I could sell a tank design, my father has been teaching my engineering and how engines work since I was a little boy and over the years I made blue prints for a light weight combination of an ATV and a Battle tank that is twice as strong as the military currently uses in the USA and would be 5 times as light weight. Also I cut down the costs dramatically for the shell casing on its bullets. Kinda scared to just go to the government or a military base cause I don’t really trust my country to not steal it and kill me to cover up the theft.

Read full topic

item.title: Where do you sell
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Except if it’s copyrighted they’ll probably just say ‘fuck it’ and then set their designers to work on something similar

You never know though, and there’s no reason not to try.

Read full topic

item.title: Where do you sell
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Copyright your design first. My uncle showed a few fishing companies his design for a net, one company waited 3 months, checked for a copyright. Now it’s out in stores and my uncle has nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Where do you sell
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

http://www.chryslergroupllc.com/en-us/footer/Pages/ContactUs.aspx
Would be your best bet. (For Jeep)

Read full topic

item.title: Where do you sell
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

They hire people to design for them (you know, designers). I don’t think they’ll ever pay people just for single designs like that. If you show it to them, they’ll prolly give you some auto generated response email (like most businesses do).

Not to mention car designs aren’t just the look of the outside. It needs to have the interior, structure, etc etc

Read full topic
